form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Capito (for herself, Mr. Cotton, Mrs. Britt, Mr. Cassidy, Mr. Scott of Florida, Mr. Cruz, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Tillis, and Mr. Scott of South Carolina) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations

form.official-title: To restrict United States voluntary and assessed contributions to the United Nations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Funding Global Terrorists Act of 2025.

section.header: Restriction on funding for United Nations

subsection.text: The United States may not make any voluntary or assessed contributions to the United Nations for assistance in Afghanistan until the Secretary of State certifies to the appropriate congressional committees that—

paragraph.text: no United States funds are used in cash shipments by the United Nations into Afghanistan;
no specially designated global terrorist organization receives funds as a result of such cash shipments; and
no foreign terrorist organization receives funds as a result of such cash shipments.

subsection.text: If, after making a certification pursuant to subsection (a), the Secretary determines that such certification is inaccurate, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.text: provide to the appropriate congressional committees—

subparagraph.text: a notification of such revocation; and
a detailed justification for such revocation.

paragraph.text: The term appropriate congressional committees means—

subparagraph.text: Committee on Foreign Relations and the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate; and
Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives.

paragraph.text: The term foreign terrorist organization means an organization that has been designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State, pursuant to section 219 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1189).

The term specially designated global terrorist organization means an organization that has been designated as a specially designated global terrorist pursuant to Executive Order 13224 (50 U.S.C. 1701 note; relating to blocking property and prohibiting transactions with persons who commit, threaten to commit, or support terrorism).
